question:
Assume that a newborn baby is a girl with probability $p$ and a boy with probability $1 - p$. Also assume that the genders of different newborns are independent of each other. Consider a person who has two children. Define the following two events: [defs] A = "both children are girls" B = "at least one of the children is a girl" [/defs] What is the conditional probability $\Pr(A|B)$?
$\frac{p}{2-p}$ $\frac{2-p}{p}$ $p$ $\frac{1}{p}$
